intro: Rhamnus alaternus subsp. munozgarmendiae, commonly known as the Iberian buckthorn, is a shrub native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in the spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or dry habitats, such as cliffs and slopes. It has a woody stem with thorny branches and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from the main species.
